body:
Hi,

I am trying to build git, but it fails with the following error message about missing dependencies:

```
==> Building git [AutotoolsPackage]
==> Executing phase : 'autoreconf'
==> Error: RuntimeError: Cannot generate configure: missing dependencies ['m4', 'autoconf', 'automake', 'libtool']
/local/cluster/spack/lib/spack/spack/build_systems/autotools.py:208, in autoreconf:
     198      def autoreconf(self, spec, prefix):
     199          """Not needed usually, configure should be already there"""
     200          # If configure exists nothing needs to be done
     201          if os.path.exists(self.configure_abs_path):
     202              return
     203          # Else try to regenerate it
     204          autotools = ['m4', 'autoconf', 'automake', 'libtool']
     205          missing = [x for x in autotools if x not in spec]
     206          if missing:
     207              msg = 'Cannot generate configure: missing dependencies {0}'
  >> 208              raise RuntimeError(msg.format(missing))
     209          tty.msg('Configure script not found: trying to generate it')
     210          tty.warn('*********************************************************')
     211          tty.warn('* If the default procedure fails, consider implementing *')
     212          tty.warn('*        a custom AUTORECONF phase in the package       *')
     213          tty.warn('*********************************************************')
     214          with working_dir(self.configure_directory):
     215              m = inspect.getmodule(self)
     216              # This part should be redundant in principle, but
     217              # won't hurt
     218              m.libtoolize()
     219              m.aclocal()
     220              # This line is what is needed most of the time
     221              # --install, --verbose, --force
     222              autoreconf_args = ['-ivf']
     223              if 'pkg-config' in spec:
     224                  autoreconf_args += [
     225                      '-I',
     226                      join_path(spec['pkg-config'].prefix, 'share', 'aclocal'),
     227                  ]
     228              autoreconf_args += self.autoreconf_extra_args
     229              m.autoreconf(*autoreconf_args)
```
The dependencies are there:

```
[sfux@develop02 ~]$ spack find autoconf automake libtool m4
==> 4 installed packages.
-- linux-centos7-x86_64 / gcc@4.8.5 -----------------------------
autoconf@2.69  automake@1.15  libtool@2.4.6  m4@1.4.18
[sfux@develop02 ~]$
```

and I have added the path to the "bin" dir to the PATH variable:
```

[sfux@develop02 ~]$ which autoreconf
/local/cluster/spack/tools/autoreconf
[sfux@develop02 ~]$ which libtool
/local/cluster/spack/tools/libtool
[sfux@develop02 ~]$ which automake
/local/cluster/spack/tools/automake
[sfux@develop02 ~]$ which m4
/local/cluster/spack/tools/m4
[sfux@develop02 ~]$
```
I get similar error messages for the packages

- glib
- fonttosfnt

Any idea what is going wrong ?

Thank you for your help and best regards
title: Git: Cannot generate configure: missing dependencies ['m4', 'autoconf', 'automake', 'libtool']
